name: oppggic

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, cgrp), wbr(c0, cgic, c1), wcel(cfv(cminusg, c0), co(c0, cgim, c1)))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cgrp), wbr(c0, cgic, c1))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(cfv(cminusg, c0), co(c0, cgim, c1)))
-| wi(wcel(cfv(cminusg, c0), co(c0, cgim, c1)), wbr(c0, cgic, c1))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ Grp → c0[~ = g]c1)
⊣ (c0 ∈ Grp →(invg ` c0)∈(c0[GrpIso]c1))
⊣ ((invg ` c0)∈(c0[GrpIso]c1)→ c0[~ = g]c1)

⊣ ((invg ` c0)∈(c0[GrpIso]c1)→ c0[~ = g]c1)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(cfv(cminusg, c0), co(c0, cgim, c1)))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(coppg, c0))

body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ Grp →(invg ` c0)∈(c0[GrpIso]c1))
⊣ c1 =(oppG ` c0)
⊣ (invg ` c0)=(invg ` c0)

comment: Every group is (naturally) isomorphic to its opposite. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 26-Aug-2015.)
